comments:
See http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22072

Path.systemClasspath has been changed to final in the latest Apache Ant.
Therefore you will get the following attempting to use this Ant version within 
Eclipse:

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException: java.lang.IllegalAccessError
        at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.setJavaClassPath(
InternalAntRunner.java:1409)
        at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRu
nner.java:504)
        at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRu
nner.java:491)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:472)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoa
der.java:858)
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)
Path.systemClasspath has been changed back to no longer be final.
